idata.python:
# Background kick drums
# Using loop to play the Note 0 
for i in range(60):
    playNote(0, beats=0.5)   # Kick hit lasts half a beat
    rest(beats=0.5)          # Rest half a beat before next kick

# Silence after the kicks finish
rest(beats=120)  # 2 minutes of silence (track end)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Define function to play the repeating pattern for each note
def play_pattern(note):
    # Play the note for half a beat
    playNote(note, beats=0.5)
    # Rest for 1 beat
    rest(beats=1)

    # Play the note again for half a beat
    playNote(note, beats=0.5)
    # Rest for half a beat
    rest(beats=0.5)

    # Play the note a third time for half a beat
    playNote(note, beats=0.5)
    # Rest for 1 beat before the next note
    rest(beats=1)

# Repeat the whole sequence 2 times
for repeat in range(2):  
    # Go through each note in the list once per repeat
    for n in [16, 18, 15, 20]:
        play_pattern(n)   # Play the pattern for the current note
# Add 2 minutes of silence so the track continue to 2nd half cleanly
rest(beats=120)

# Second layer bass 
# Define function to play the repeating pattern for each note
def play_pattern(note):
    # Play the note for half a beat
    playNote(note, beats=0.5)
    # Rest for 1 beat
    rest(beats=1)

    # Play the note again for half a beat
    playNote(note, beats=0.5)
    # Rest for half a beat
    rest(beats=0.5)

    # Play the note a third time for half a beat
    playNote(note, beats=0.5)
    # Rest for 1 beat before the next note
    rest(beats=1)

# Repeat the whole sequence 2 times
for repeat in range(2):  
    # Go through each note in the list once per repeat
    for n in [16, 18, 15, 20]:
        play_pattern(n)   # Play the pattern for the current note
# Add 2 minutes of silence so the track continue to 2nd half cleanly
rest(beats=120)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
#Rest for 32 beats to continue the first hafl
rest(beats=32)

# Define a helper function to play a flexible rhythm pattern for any note
def play_pattern(note, rest_times):
    for r in rest_times:
        playNote(note, beats=0.5)  # Play note for half a beat
        rest(beats=r)              # Rest for 'r' beats

# Define the rhythm (rest durations) for each note section
patterns = [
    (16, [1, 0.5, 1]),                 # Note 16 pattern
    (18, [0.35, 0.35, 0.5, 0.80]),     # Note 18 pattern
    (15, [1, 0.5, 1]),                 # Note 15 pattern
    (20, [0.35, 0.35, 0.5, 0.80])      # Note 20 pattern
]

# Play the full melody twice 
for repeat in range(2):
    for note, rests in patterns:
        play_pattern(note, rests)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Start with an initial rest before the pattern begins
rest(beats=32)

# Define a function to play a rhythm pattern for one note
def play_pattern(note, rest_times):
    
    for r in rest_times:
        playNote(note, beats=0.5)  # Play the note for half a beat
        rest(beats=r)              # Rest for the specified time

# Define the rhythm pattern 
clap_pattern = [
    1, 0.5, 1,          # First section
    0.35, 0.35, 0.5, 0.80,  # Second section (shorter rests)
    1, 0.5, 1,          # Third section
    0.35, 0.35, 0.5, 0.80   # Fourth section (repeats feel)
]

# Repeat the full pattern 2 times, then stop
for repeat in range(2):
    play_pattern(10, clap_pattern)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Intro silence so the part enters later
rest(beats=32)

# Helper to play one note with a custom series of rests between hits
def play_pattern(note, rest_times):

    for r in rest_times:
        playNote(note, beats=0.5)  # 0.5-beat hit
        rest(beats=r)              # rest for r beats

# Your rhythm (rests between hits), grouped for readability
hihat_pattern = [
    1, 0.5, 1,                 # section A
    0.35, 0.35, 0.5, 0.80,     # section B
    1, 0.5, 1,                 # section A (again)
    0.35, 0.35, 0.5, 0.80      # section B (again)
]

# Play the full pattern exactly 2 times, then stop
for _ in range(2):
    play_pattern(4, hihat_pattern)
